magpie.utility.interfaces

Interface Commandable

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractNonlinearRegression, AbstractParsedNonlinearRegression, ActiveLearningOptimizer, AllMetalsSplitter, AttributeIntervalSplitter, BaseAttributeSelector, BaseClassifier, BaseClusterer, BaseDatasetNormalizer, BaseDatasetSplitter, BaseModel, BaseOptimizer, BaseRegression, BaseStatistics, BatchModelEvaluator, BestIndividualSelector, ClassificationRegression, ClassificationStatistics, ClustererSplitter, CompositeRegression, CompositionBasedCSPEngine, CompositionDataset, CSPEngine, CumulantExpansionClassifier, Dataset, DatasetHelper, DatasetOutput, DMSPEngine, ElementDataset, GeneticAlgorithm, GuessMeanRegression, IndependentVariableNormalizer, InverseNormalizer, IonicCompoundFinder, LASSORegression, LinearCorrectedRegression, MeasuredClassSplitter, MeredigAttributeSelector, MetallurgicalHeuristicRegression, MixedMetalsSplitter, MixingRuleRegression, MultiObjectiveRegression, MultipleElementGroupsSplitter, MultiPropertyDataset, MultiPropertyRegression, NonlinearRegressionExpr, NonZeroClassificationSplitter, ObjectiveFunctionSplitter, OxidationStateGuesser, PhaseDiagramExclusionValidator, PolynomialRegression, PredictedClassIntervalSplitter, PrototypeDataset, RandomGuessRegression, RegexAttributeSelector, RegressionStatistics, RegularSolutionNormalizer, RescalingNormalizer, ScikitLearnRegression, SimpleLinearModelExample, SingleElementGroupSplitter, SingleGuessRegression, SoftmaxNormalizer, SplitClassifier, SplitModel, SplitRegression, StagedRegression, TargetRegressionStatistics, UserSpecifiedAttributeSelector, UserSpecifiedExcludingAttributeSelector, WekaAttributeSelector, WekaClassifier, WekaClusterer, WekaRegression, ZScoreNormalizer

    public interface Commandable
    Provides interface for classes that can handle commands. Utilized by CommandHandler.

    Commands are passed in the form of a list of objects. Under most conditions, these are simply text strings, but one must ensure that in order to be safe.

    Anything can be output by a command. If nothing needs to be output, the function should simply return null.

    Errors during command processing should throw Exceptions.

    After you are done adding a command, make sure to document it in the class's Javadoc (see BaseClusterer for an example). Format should be:

    <command><p><b>command usage</b> - Description of command
    <br><pr><i>option name</i>: Description of option
    <br>Details about command</command>

    Surround names of a user option with <>'s. Signify that the parameter is optional by surrounding it with []'s. If the parameter must be an object, place a $ in front of the command name. As an example:

    crossvalidate $<data> [<folds>] - Cross validate a model
    data: Dataset used during cross-validation
    folds: How many folds to use in validation process (default = 10)

      java.lang.Object runCommand(java.util.List<java.lang.Object> Command)
      Process some command described by a list of Objects.

    • Method Detail

      • runCommand

        java.lang.Object runCommand(java.util.List<java.lang.Object> Command)
                            throws java.lang.Exception
        Process some command described by a list of Objects.
        Parameters:
        Command - Command as a list of objects
        Returns:
        Any output (null if no output generated by command)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If something goes wrong
